column1: Please excuse me for the long message
column2: but I wanted to share a personal story
column3: not something that you would perhaps enjoy reading but nevertheless
column4: here goes. I grew up in the IIT Madras campus
column5: a lush 250 hectare area that was all one huge forest
column6: and a good part of it still continues to be
column7: although the proportion has gone down signficantly.

column3: deer and fox) were all routine events (we even saw a crocodile once!). During my 20 years in the IIT campus
column4: there have been reports of several poisonous (cobras
column5: vipers
column6: kraits) but mostly they were all non-poisonous snakes (rat snakes and green vine snakes). There were no casualties that I knew of (people even used to say that it was because of the famous Jalakandeshwara temple in the campus)
column7: until some years later. My neighbor (who was also my Biology teacher in school) was bitten by a venomous snake in her own garden. Due to the complications that arose from that
column8: she has been crippled in her leg ever since.

column1: Just to put probabilities in perspective
column2: we are talking about a life-altering incident that took place in a place with a lot fewer poisonous snake-encounters
column3: a lot more green area (for the snakes to stay away from humans)
column4: and a lot less population density. Not to mention that there was access to an in-campus hospital with ambulance and anti-venom and zero traffic jams. Every single snake that we have spotted in JR Greenwich is in the Big Four.

column1: Six years and no casualties sounds more like a ticking time bomb than something to take pride in (btw
column2: there has been one snake-bite incident already). Yes
column3: we all trust and respect nature and the greater forces and our karmas. But there's also the science and the statistics and the common sense.

column2: better safe than sorry should be our overarching goal. One that we should be proactively
column3: collectively taking steps towards
column4: no?

the concerns specific to snakes are valid but please review few points below :

column1: 1. Multiple suggestions as a preventive measure were made in the past each time a snake was spotted/caught. A sub-committee was set up to discuss ways and means. A snake catcher by name snake Babu was invited who appeared one of the evenings & went around our layout. Some  committee members & interested residents    joined him. He caught 3 snakes that day - one cobra at the STP
column2: one Viper from the debris near villa 12&13 under construction and a second cobra by magic by the catcher's assistant which need not be discussed here. Once the exercise was over
column3: we learnt the following :

column1: (a) all the boasting the catcher exhibited initially that he could follow snake's trails and can even pull out a snake from a rat hole etc  remained a hype and just a marketing tool of his profession. Our learning was echoed by Mr. Prithvi (the snake expert with more than10 years of research experience) and Mr.Kartik ( a trained snake catcher). Both these experts have told us that there is nothing called following the trails/smell of snakes and catching them and if someone says so
column2: he is purely a business minded guy.

column3: Prithvi & Kartik showed us many hiding places for the snakes viz. Piled up debris
column4: clusters of construction blocks/materials
column5: open areas in the compound wall
column8: flower pots in clusters kept in the set back areas of Villas as well as some plants that are very bushy having no ground clearance
column9: utilities which had piled up items & so on.

column1: (c) while follow up for debris clearance was a routine item in the residents meeting or WhatsApp
column2: JRH has been doing that excercise periodically and in the recent meeting too
column3: Niranjan had committed to do that which he re-iterated today as a response to multiple requests. If you all remember
column4: a maison was deployed by Bhaskar for a few days exclusively to plug all visible open areas which too was completed. If some more have surfaced now due to the rodents' night duty
column5: we need to plug them as well.

column1: (d) can all the individual Villa owners look around the set back & utility area and act on the grey areas mentioned in (c) above ?
2. Realising Mr.Prithvi's experience/expertise could come in handy to address/answer many a concerns/questions the residents had
column3: we arranged for an interactive session with him. While the attendance was not discouraging
column4: certainly it was not in tune with the topic much talked about. Sorry to say that most of the concerns/suggestions that got pumped in since yesterday were addressed in that session in terms of practicality
column5: implementability etc. Due to the very nature of the session and many slides etc used
column6: we could not write a detailed note but key points were sent as takeaways. One point was on children wearing full jeans and sports shoes while at play on grassy park - how many do follow this ?

column2: there was a general check list that was sent in the group - a week later when I happened to speak to a resident about it
column3: I was asked " is it
column4: I did not see it & can you resend?".

column2: 7:01 PM - +91 97405 83964: My take as i have tried two of the apps so far:

column1: 1. FTH Daily (Fresh to Home) -> Initial months you get lot of cashbacks. No delivery charges for milk. Delivery is quite early in the morning (mostly by 6am). Very nice User interface
2. BB daily : Initial 20 days free milk of 500ml. No delivery charges for milk. Lot of issues with the delivery of veg/bread/paneer kind of items. But milk supply
column2: no major issues. User interface is bit tricky.

column1: 3. Supr -> Not yet tried. This is owned by Swiggy. So it could be good.

column2: all of us were on this. A lot of issues. Delivery of milk is chargeable. Also non milk items are painful. Also cutoff time to change the order is not till 9pm previous day.

column1: Our House keeping & gardening staff have reported sighting dog poop  in many places in common  area of our layout. As stated in the bye-laws
column2: it is the responsibility of the owner taking the pet out for walk to clean it up without fail. Please note that our housekeeping staff will not clean such mess.  Also please note that :

column1: * the Pets should be accompanied by the Owners at all  time when they are out and can't be left free unleashed.
*  there are no bins kept in the layout for scoop disposals and the owner should find the right way to dispose. Waste Bins in common area should never be used for such diaposals please.
*the Pet Owners / Handlers are requested to be sensitive towards comfort level of the other  residents around  especially children and senior citizens.
*taking the pets into the main park including  the play area / walkways is not allowed.
Security has been updated and instructed accordingly. Any violations  will be dealt with fines and penalties.
Beehive removal vendor is removing  beehive from Club house.
Request Residents of 2nd cross to close your windows and doors.
We are facing the shortage  of house keeping staffs from last One week.
All 3 female Hk staffs are on leave and not returned to duty  so far.
Now Our Gardening staffs are sweeping and picking up the dry leaves on the roads.
We are trying to fill up the Hk staffs at earliest.
Your child is appearing for his/her boards ...
Its indeed a proud moment that your child has excelled beautifully in his/her journey till STD 9th/ STD 10th / STD 12th

column2: now that they are starting with their exams
column3: next 20 days is going to be crucial from them as well as you too.
enthusiasm
column4: relaxed behavior
column5: rudeness etc can be expected from the children.

column1: And it's ok since lot of unnecessary stress has been built up by our education system
column2: when it comes to Board Exams.

column1: Some simple tips which can be implemented from your end
column2: to help your child cope up with the stress.

column1: 1 Please wake them up in the morning with a positive stroke
column2: a touch/ hug  which a child expects from his parents.

column1: 2 Start your child's day with a positive statement - I love you
column2: come let's start this beautiful day together etc

column1: 3 Take care about the communication you have with your child
column2: before s/he leaves for his exams. I am sure you will excel
column3: I am sure you will give your best
column4: all luck to you
column5: I will be waiting for you to come back sweetheart....etc

column1: 4  Do not let your anxiety pass on to your child. Whatever the situation is
column2: last moment positive support from your end will give a boost to your child's confidence
please avoid asking only how was the exam
column3: instead ask....how was the experience....

column2: let's go out for sometime / let's have a cup of coffee together etc

column1: Gone is gone...you can't alter that but atleast you can support the child for the coming one.
6 Please ensure that a very happy and healthy atmosphere is given to the child in the house during his exams.
Avoid unnecessary arguments within the family
Don't forget- that will affect your child and that will add to his stress
7 Please play soft instrumental music while the child is having his breakfast or relaxing with you
8 Avoid giving marks target to the child.He is sensible enough to understand his targets
9 Keep fresh flowers in the house
column2: that brings lots of positivity in the house
make the child sleep..your two minutes will give him sound sleep for some hours
column3: that will help the child to combat with the situation

column1: 13 Stand by your child even if the exam has not gone as per your or his expectations..It's ok...

column2: don't let the child meet the relatives or friends
column3: last moment negative statements or expectations might prove detrimental for the child.

column1: Lots of love to your child and

column2: be patient and all luck to you too
column3: my dear parents.

10:09 AM - JrGopal128Wood: *Message from a Doctor from Bangalore :

column1: Despite all the requests and warnings
column2: We continue to see our people from (apartment name) gather around during the evenings and make the most of their “stay at home “ situation. Kids continue to play in groups while parents are taking a break.

column1: Please understand it’s very important to restrict movements currently
column2: including morning and evening walks . And it’s very important to stay indoors and not in play areas or lawns

column1: Many doctors including myself are working with sick people daily and are seeing how people are succumbing to illnesses very quickly during these times. I have seen many of my own colleagues being quarantined because they have treated patients suspected with COVID -19. One of the doctors hasn’t seen her 3 year old toddler for nearly 4 days now.

Medical personnel who are treating these patients are working like soldiers putting their own lives and families at risk . It’s a shame that the rest of the community is ignoring the health hazard and having cricket matches in the lawn and late evening chat parties.
COVID 19 is no longer a problem that’s only in present some other part of the world . It’s here now

Please stay away from each other as much as possible. We can not afford any body being sick in our neighbourhood . The reason being that we have a large number of children and elderly people . Even moderately affected people may end up requiring ICU beds and we don’t have many in this area or in the city itself. Imagine not being able to find a suitable hospital bed with a sick child or an elderly parent.
The reason for all the worry about COVID is that even if 10 people in a group of 100 get affected and they keep moving around
column2: they can infect the rest of the healthy 90 people in a matter of hours. Even if 10 of those hundred get very sick
column3: we will run out of ICU beds in our vicinity .

column1: One doesn’t have to be symptomatic to infect others
column2: about 40-50% of the affected people are asymptomatic.

column1: So please stop assuming that you are a super human and it won’t affect you or your family . Please be responsible citizens and make it worth while for the medical personnel to fight against this pandemic disease
column2: who are putting ourselves and our families at higher risks .........and no doctors /nurses can’t work from home .

column1: We will continue to fight for the community no matter what but please don’t make us feel like idiots by being irresponsible citizens and continue to ignore the messages to do social distancing 🙏🏻

column1: Today security was informed by one of the maids working in ahad euphoria and few residents reached out to EC regarding one of the residents with travel history to USA and having symptoms of being sick with cough.

We have reached out to the concerned residents who has mentioned that there are no covid symptoms to the person. From safety perspective the family has self quarantined themselves in the home. However going by the safety guidelines and following the protocol we have advised them to call up 104 helpline number and inform the authorities.
All Wing lift is cleansed with cleansing liquid.

Residents are required to not venture out of the house untill and unless extremely important and even in that case please take precautions. This will be observed till we get a clear signal from the authorities. Please note this situation should in no way target the individual or any group.
We request residents to not believe in rumor's.

It has been reported by helpdesk that residents are calling helpdesk for information/report regarding this case. At this point of time there is no positive case in Ahad euphoria. We request to be careful and not create panic.We expect cooperation from residents during this exercise.
We will wait for authorities confirmation.

May be I am sounding a little over cautious but still wanted to share

This is in continuation of our earlier communications  regarding the measures to prevent the spread of Covid-19. MC members had a meeting today to discuss about the compliance to our previous advisories as well as added measures keeping in mind the changes since the last communication. The gist of the discussions and decisions are :
1. Social distancing : this is the need of the hour and has been highlighted in our previous communication.  MC has observed that the activities in groups  by Children
column2: adults & senior citizens  including walking in groups & chatting
column3: playing on large groups etc continues. For now we would request additional caution to be exercised at individual level and maintain adequate distance in interactions (at least ~6 feet as per guideline from various sources).  In case of additional restrictions needed
column4: and social distance becoming a mandate
column5: entry to the main park might need to be blocked which we want to avoid. Please follow & advise your children / parents too.

column1: 2. Maids/Cooks/Drivers : Our previous communication had an expectation from individual owners to ascertain from these helps about their place of stay
column3: work details outside of JRG just from a risk assessment perspective. Just by observation and discussion with the maids entering
column4: our security confirms that there are some maids / cooks who are common to Ahad and  JRG. Please review and do the needful at your end.

column1: *3. Self quarantine : Residents who have gone into self quarantining are not to come out and socialise at any cost till the prescribed quarantine period is over. The scope of this requirement is extended to those who travelled to & from affected areas in India (in addition to overseas travel earlier).*
To do our part in preventing the spread and keep our community safe
column3: the *MC has considered additional measures below* to further limit exposure from outside entries :

column1: 1) Stopping enty of newspaper delivery personnel - from tomorrow.
2) Stopping entry of car wash/cleaning personnel - from tomorrow
3) All the deliveries at main gate only except groceries and milk. To reduce the exposure to our security staff
column2: please postpone non critical  orders/services for sometime. *Also please take precautions while handling deliveries and if possible sanitize before use*.

column1: 4) Individual Villa owner to review the process to address the potential risk in getting maids/cooks who work outside of JRG and *educate them for taking precautions outside and inside of our community*.
5) Construction workers come and go out straight to their work site
column2: not to interact  with other staff
column3: if situation demands then their entry will be stopped completely.

column1: 6) All workers & delivery guys (Grocery & Milk) to wash hands at the main gate prior to getting in. Provision for the same is being made today.

These are difficult measures which will cause inconvenience to all of us including our helps/vendors/support system. But are needed to support the prevention efforts and will be applicable from tomorrow. As and when the situation permits to relax these
column2: the same will be communicated in writing. Request your much required cooperation and also to inform service providers for same.

column1: *Also request you to consider conveying to service providers that this change is temporary and their payments will be made (paid time off). This is based on suggestions received for individuals to consider on humanitarian ground. This money guarantee will also help boost their morale and get  back to work once the situation improves and permits their entry so any additional support to service providers in this time will be highly appreciated.*

*_The MC earnestly requests the residents not to send back a rejoinder/response into this advisory. Any specific genuine concerns may please be directed to our association mail id : jrgassociation@gmail.com_*
Thanks for your attention & co-operation. Stay safe and wishing all the best of health.
JR Greenwich Site and House Owners' Association

column1: 1. Why the bathrooms and toilets were *outside* our houses and not *inside*.

3. Why the footwear has to be kept outside the house and not inside.
4. Why we have to wash our hands and feet when we returned from schools or outside after playing.
5. Why a mandatory 10 days isolation / quarantine (especially at a birth or death) in traditional households.
6. Why the households must not cook if there's a dead body inside the house.
7. Why the washing of discarded clothes has to be done outside the house and not inside.
8. Why was it mandatory to be clean and have bath before cooking for the house.

column1: Let’s try to do for a day tomorrow and then see the difference
“Whatever we are talking about is what we are perpetuating in our experience. The only way to keep any kind of illness or virus or flu away is to not talk about it and it will dissipate itself.

What we do instead is keep checking the statistics or keep spreading the "awareness" messages on social media without noticing it that the more we talk about it the more it becomes active in our vibration. History is full of evidence of epidemics because of the mass consciousness created by fear of the disease. Fear is a very strong vibration and more fearful we are of any epidemic it becomes a reality very fast.. it's the law. The more you feed the energy of fear the more profound it becomes.

Ignore the things you don't want to participate in. Stop discussing it with family and friends; stop checking out the latest statistics. Stop watching incessantly the news about Corona Virus. Take your attention away and It has no power on you. The creation of anything is to give thought to it by keeping it active in our vibration by being afraid of it. Hook yourself up with  ever flowing stream of well- being”.
Let us stop Corona talk in this group for 2-3 days and try :).*

column1: Appreciate your  support extended  on all the measures and efforts specific to Covid19 prevention. Following are some *additional  updates/information* post our previous communication...
1) Given the movement restrictions and to further reduce the risk from their  surroundings
column2: our electrician and security staff will be staying temporarily with in the layout which they have also requested. The STP operator has been given a letter to carry while commuting back & forth. The housekeeping staff who stay in the sheds nearby have been briefed the do's and don'ts both inside and outside the layout.   *We are looking to provide all possible support to our association staff including their safety
column3: precautions
column4: eatables etc and minimizing their outside exposure.*

column2: we have *started spraying disinfectants* on our internal roads and other possible areas of exposure.

column1: 3) All of us have been managing successfully one of the most difficult measures i.e  keeping kids inside the house. Request to continue with the same and *not to let them group up with other kids.*
4) Due to delivery issues with daily essentials
column2: we understand  going out became a necessity. We hope deliveries to be getting better back  soon. Our request is to totally avoid or  if it is so really critical
column3: minimise by clubbing such moves since *we  are onto the next phase of this pandemic and the outside exposure could prove too costly.* Appreciate the same already being done by fellow residents for the milk purchases last couple of days. *Anyone forced to take out a vehicle
column4: once back
column5: please leave the vehicle under sunlight  away from the car porch of the Villa for a long duration. Please continue to sanitize and take precautions for all your deliveries

column1: 5) Waste clearance & Fumigation services may get occassionally impacted in the coming days. We will try to manage with the available resources as much as we can. *Also hope you might be taking all the precautions handling/sanitizing garbage bins.*

column3: is the motivation and aim of all these efforts.* Any one villa getting in the unfortunate grip of this disease may impact the well-being of the whole community. We appreciate alert residents highlighting to us violations to guidelines whenever the same was observed. Necessary action has been taken from our end and will continue to do so. Let's collectively avoid such actions calling for reminders / notices by following the requirements to the fullest and win this challenge as a team.

column1: Some resources to help with kids at home:

Further to our last communication on Covid19 prevention measures
1. Inspite of our best efforts to retain *our housekeeping staff*
column2: all of them  *have gone back to their home town.* As a result
column3: sweeping the streets / other common areas
column4: pruning of park /lawn grass & shrubs
column5: watering all common greens etc are impacted. In discussion with *Abhijit & Balareddy
column6: * the least that we could workout  is *to water the common greens on non-water release days* which they will handle early in the morning and late in the afternoon. If you spot them near your Villa / street while they are on the job
column7: *please be kind enough to ask if they want any help anywhere*. STP Basha too will pitch in  as much as he can side by side working on STP processing.

column1: 2. While preserving the greens is our top priority
column2: *we are not in a position to assign anyone to sweep & clear the falling from the trees or the dust.* That leaves us with the only option to clean as much as we can till the situation improves.

column1: 3. We have been notified by *Hasiru Dala* that :

column2: gloves and tissues used to cover while sneezing/coughing or moving out should be  separately wrapped in a paper and red marked with a "X".*  The collection guy will come with a separate bag and the respective resident will need to personally dump it in the prescribed bag. Mixing with other waste is strictly prohibited.

column1: (b) their waste segregation site is having some space issue and hence there *may arise a time when they may stop collecting dry waste.* In preparation
column2: please start washing & drying any wet bags or cartons before putting that into the dry waste bag so that in case of a stoppage
column3: it does not stink.

column1: 4. Fumigation vendor has not got a pass & hence *daily  fumigation won't be taking place till further notice.*
5. The validity of our preventive measures gets *extended to April 14* in line with the government order *Please continue to follow all preventive measures advised till date
column2: be it on social distancing or going out or sanitization etc.*

column1: 6. The surroundings being quiet and the weather being very hot
column2: *chances of snakes coming out from their hideouts can not be ruled out.* With the cluster of dry leaves etc
column3: they may find a spot to take shelter. Hence please take necessary precautions while getting out of your villa & ensure everyone in the family is made aware of it.

column1: The last few days since the lockdown have been difficult on all of us.  We are all doing things differently  be it about work
column3: food or even movements.

column1: We need to keep this control on  for a few more days.  The more effectively we do
column2: the more safer we are and more healthier we are as a community.

column1: We also want to make a request to all of you… *Of late
column2: we are increasingly noticing kids and adults being casual about the need for social distancing.* We understand that it is very difficult for us to manage kids and their movement.  But this (as you know) is for their own health and for the health of every member of the community (especially the most vulnerable ones ).  *So
column3: please talk to everyone in the family and make them understand that this is for their health and for the community.*

column2: many kids (some adults too) are reminded of social distancing when they see few office bearers face to face while  walking.  This is funny because they seem to think that it is just a rule that we (association) have put and do not realize that it is for their good and for the community.  *Please note that we do not believe in "policing"… 😊 this is true even when  any of us give a friendly advice.*

column1: Sorry for the long message… but hope all of you are onboard on this one and talk to kids and adults alike regarding the need to maintain *what is the prime need of today - "SOCIAL DISTANCING".*
JR Greenwich Site and House Owners' Association

column1: Appreciate your  support thus far  on all the measures and efforts specific to Covid19 prevention. Following are further *updates/information* post our previous communication along with reiteration of some important points/observations...
1) The validity of our preventive measures gets *extended to 3rd May* in line with the government order. *Request for continue to follow all preventive measures advised till date*.
2) All of us have been managing successfully one of the most difficult task i.e  distancing
column2: managing kids inside house etc. Request to continue with the same and *not to let ourselves
column3: kids or senior citizens group with others.* Specific to proper orientation to kids
column4: please show them a video attached below and make them understand the need.

column1: 3) There has been observation of increased number of community vehicles getting out/in.  We believe deliveries are getting better. Our request is to totally avoid or if it is so really critical
column2: minimise  such moves since *any outside exposure could prove too costly now*. Our main gate security is keeping a log of all such movements & the association may choose to notify the concerned.

column1: 4) Increased visits/walks to the vegetable shop right oppsite to the main gate/near-by gated communities has been observed and request to minimise/avoid such movements.

column2: our request to avoid any visits of relatives / friends from outside has been honoured by the majority. While thanking you for that
column3: request to maintain it till further notice.

column1: 6) Anyone forced to take out a vehicle
column3: please leave the vehicle under sunlight  away from the car porch of the Villa for a long duration. *Please continue to sanitize and take precautions for all your deliveries
column4: purchases
column5: garbage bin etc while handling/getting into the house.*

column1: 7) The surroundings being quiet and the weather being very hot
column2: *chances of snakes coming out from their hideouts can not be ruled out.* With the cluster of dry leaves etc
column3: they may find a spot to take shelter. Hence please take necessary precautions while getting out of your villa & ensure everyone in the family is made aware of it. Also
column4: please educate your children not to crowd & shout near a place where a snake is spotted and catching efforts are underway. A recent catching effort near the security cabin in phase 2 could not succeed since the snake ran away due to the commotion created by the kids before the catcher arrived.

column3: is the motivation and aim of all these efforts.* Any one villa getting in the unfortunate grip of this disease may impact the well-being of the whole community. We appreciate alert residents highlighting to us violations to guidelines whenever the same was observed. Necessary action has been taken from our end and will continue to do so.

column1: *Once again thank you for your attention on the communications and cooperation in following all the measures.*
JR Greenwich Site and House Owners' Association

column1: A few farmers from around Bangalore are trying to sell their grapes directly to apartment complexes. Considering the lockdown
column2: exports & even transportation to across states is significantly hampered. These farmers approached food based WhatsApp group admins & sought help to organize farmers markets in apartments. One such group - Eonfoody has successfully enabled sales of over a tonne of grapes in areas such as Richmond Town
column3: Cooke Town & Kalyan Nagar. This group is now enabling access to more locations as the fresh batch of grapes gets ready for harvest.

column1: A new batch is arriving into Bangalore on 24th April morning. Eonfoody is planning the schedule & has lined up 2 hour slots in various gated communities such as Rohan Jharokha where these farmers would put up a farmers market from 11am to 1pm. Available slots are 8am to 10am
column2: 2pm to 4pm & 5pm to 7pm. Do let us know if your apartment would be open to the idea of a farmers market. All due precaution related to social distancing & hygiene will be adopted.

column1: The farmers are selling Bangalore Blue grapes (used specifically for making grape juice & wine due to its favorable taste) & green seedless grapes (medium sized).
Cost per box - Bangalore Blue Grapes: with seeds in 5kg box - Rs. 170
Green Seedless grapes (2 kg box costs Rs. 140).

column1: I hope you all are doing well.

column3: unique in it ability to bring together supplies
column4: logistics
column5: and funds to make an immediate and fast local impact on affected communities. Thoda Bahut is built on one of India's leading fundraiser platform and NGO called GiveIndia.org. More on the mission and how it works on https://thodabahut.org/faq/

column1: The scope of the first campaign is to deliver supplies to thousands of frontline healthcare professionals and the police force in Bangalore. We're expanding as we go. Any organization may come forward to extend this platform to make a local impact
column2: for this community or another of their interest
column3: or replicate the model in another city.

column1: For a bit of perspective during these frustrating times

column3: and ends on your 18th birthday. 22 million people perish in that war. Later in the year
column4: a Spanish Flu epidemic hits the planet and runs until your 20th birthday. 50 million people die from it in those two years. Yes
column5: 50 million. On your 29th birthday
column6: the Great Depression begins. Unemployment hits 25%
column7: the World GDP drops 27%. That runs until you are 33. The country nearly collapses along with the world economy. When you turn 39
column8: World War II starts. You aren’t even over the hill yet. And don’t try to catch your breath. On your 41st birthday
column9: the United States is fully pulled into WWII. Between your 39th and 45th birthday
column10: 75 million people perish in the war. At 50
column11: the Korean War starts. 5 million perish. At 55 the Vietnam War begins and doesn’t end for 20 years. 4 million people perish in that conflict. On your 62nd birthday you have the Cuban Missile Crisis
column12: a tipping point in the Cold War. Life on our planet
column14: should have ended. Great leaders prevented that from happening. When you turn 75
column15: the Vietnam War finally ends. Think of everyone on the planet born in 1900. How do you survive all of that? When you were a kid in 1985 and didn’t think your 85 year old grandparent understood how hard school was. And how mean that kid in your class was. Yet they survived everything listed above.

column1: Let’s try and keep things in perspective.

column1: A few BESCOM consumers have repeatedly complained that the bill received during May 2020 have been calculated irrationally and charged higher rates. The reason being that while computing the readings the BESCOM has charged higher rates without considering the basic slab rates. Therefore
column2: the consumers feel that the bill charged is more than the actual consumption of power. The BESCOM likes to issue a clarification on this regard as follows.

column1: In the wake of lockdown announced owing to Covid 19 pandemonium
column2: as per the directions of the Energy Department
column3: the BESCOM has issued electricity bills to all the HT and LT and 40 HP and above installations based on the actual reading
column4: while for all other categories of consumers
column5: bill was issued based on the average readings of their preceding months. It was made it clear that it is only a one time measure for the month of April 2020. And the regular billing and collection activity would resume as before from the month of May 2020 onwards. Any difference in the average bill and the actual reading would be adjusted in the subsequent moth bill.

column2: due to various reasons including increase in the use of fans
column3: ACs
column4: and as many of the IT and BT as well as other sector personal are working from home
column5: the maximum demand reading and consumption has gone slightly higher in the month of April. Consequently the meter reading done in the month of May the meter reading done has been high for the domestic category. Also the unpaid amount of the April month has been added resulting in higher amount.

column1: The BESCOM categorically makes it clear that all rationals have been followed while calculating the electricity bills.

If the consumers feel that the bill charged is more than the actual consumption and also the the bill is calculated irrationally without following norms can make complaints at BESCOM Helpline 1912 and get redressal.

column1: Further to our message this morning
column2: appreciate your patience while we were deliberating the way forward specific to domestic help. In line with the recent government notification of relaxing the rules around lockdown as well as inputs from other RWAs around
column3: the MC in today's meeting finalized the following process for us in JRG:

column1: 1) "KYS - Know your support-staff" form is being introduced which has the first 2 pages for filling up and submission & the rest containing specific instructions/guidelines for you to refer. Each villa owner who is wanting to get the services of a  maid  is expected to fill up this form
column2: sign it and submit to association email ID [jrgassociation@gmail.com] with CC to our estate manager's mail id (jrg.estatemanager@gmail.com)

column1: 2) One (1) form has to be submitted per villa per support-staff. At this point
column2: you are to fill up & submit the form only for maid help & not for any other. Even if a maid is working in more than one villa
column3: it is mandatory for each service taking the owner to fill up and submit this form.

column1: 3)  The KYS form will be reviewed for each support staff and in case of potential issues/clarifications
column2: the concerned villa-owner will be contacted.

column1: 4) Temperature checks will be performed at the main-gate using a non-contact thermometer for all support staff entering the complex - Residents need to make their support staff aware of the extra step at the gate.
5) The support staff is expected to follow all other precautions like the use of masks
column3: sanitizers
column4: social distance
column5: etc while being within the JRG complex.

column2: the above process will be prioritized ONLY for "Maids"
column3: considering the volume of information that may be needed to be processed /reviewed. Key timelines for the "maid" forms are

column1: a) Submit all forms for maids by Tuesday 12th May
b) Maid re-entry into JRG will open on Sunday 17th May (13-16th will be processing & other preparatory time)
c) If a resident misses the deadline for 12th May
column2: they can still submit the form later - However
column3: it can/may take a cycle time of up to 1 week from the date of submission before the reviews of those forms can be concluded.

column1: The MC decided to release the timeline for the rest of the support-staff in due course of time since this exercise is going to be done in phases. Consequent to this allowance
column2: previously intimated guidelines on the way residents conduct outside of their Villas would become even more stringent and hence a separate message would follow on that. Thanks for your support and patience as we try and get our processes streamlined in the new times!

column1: We want to let you all know that all emails that come into association mail id & seeking a response do get appropriate attention.  We need you to understand that some of the mails/requests need the MC to review before the response is sent to the sender and hence will take time.  You may also note that the regular MC meetings take place on a monthly basis and only just recently we did meet as needed due to the current COVID issues.
Also important when you are sending the emails
column2: recommend that these emails and messages should be professional and with due consideration of the amount of work that is required. Do note that any emails that are derogatory/abusive will result in the sender arguing "with a wall". Hence writer discretion is highly recommended if he/she is looking for an answer.

column1: Please also note that the association or its office bearers do not treat differently a member for raising a concern as long as the same is genuine and not pointing fingers. This becomes even more important because MC members are not employees of the association and are volunteering their time and investing their valuable personal time in service to this JRG community.

column3: do not expect a reply the moment an email hits the association mail deck. For the sender to know that the mail has been received
column4: an auto acknowledgment message has been configured so that the sender does not need to follow up with a reminder.

column2: which will be in the best interest of the community. Thanks in advance for your understanding & co-operation.

column1: *Update on the maids/ Domestic helps entry into the community.*
*17 Villas submitted forms till 5pm today* . Their maids will be allowed entry from tomorrow.

column2: if any villa resident wants entry for any new Regular Domestic Help (maid/cook/gardner/driver/car cleaner)
column3: they should fill the form we have sent earlier for each domestic help and submit to Jayaram via email .

column2: update the security staff accordingly and communicate back to you ASAP.

column1: After you receive the  communication back from Jayaram
column2: these persons will be allowed entry from the next day.

column1: Please note that ONLY the Domestic help that have forms submitted will be allowed by the security staff.
-- the temperature of the Domestic Help person is checked (<37 deg).
-- is expected to wash hands with the soap at the main gate and wear mask.
--Wearing mask is compulsory at all times when the person is within the community
--The security has been asked to not allow gathering/chit chatting between maids/domestic help.
--No spitting is allowed within the community campus.
We recommend the  Residents to reinforece these messages with your Domestic Help persons and ask them to comply with the same.
In addition to the above we recommend that you keep track of
1. Any travel history they (and their family) might have especially in RED and ORANGE zones
column2: and allow them to work accordingly following due government guidelines.

column1: 2. Check the Covid-19 status in their localities on daily basis
3. Install Arogya Setu app and ask your maids also to install Arogya Setu app
4. Know which all villas or any other apartment your maid visits
5. Ensure they wash their hands and legs with Soap before they enter your home
6. Ensure they wear mask inside your home at all times.
7. Ensure small kids and adults with other risk factors maintain safe distance
Thank you for all the support and help us keep our community Covid-19 free.

column3: Amazon

column1: 3) Construction workers to be strictly monitored for compliance like wearing mask etc. Not allowed to go to any place other than specific construction site. Adherence to be ensured by respective construction villa owner.

a) Try to take delivery and handle packages with caution as most of us might already be doing.
b) Try to limit service personnel entry till respective villa parking area. If someone needs to enter the villa for service

column1: All of us are  routinely getting updated about the goings on in Bangalore in terms of the number of Covid infections
column2: which is currently on a day to day increasing trend.  With the recent opening up of our gates for domestic helps
column3: un-avoidable freelance service guys etc. and a few of the residents going out to office locations as well
column4: we too need to do a sanity check on our strict compliance to previously communicated advisories. The MC members reviewed and  felt an urgent need to re-iterate the following :

column1: (1) *Wearing of masks while stepping out of your Villa* : Please note that this has been a mandatory requirement and more so now irrespective whether you are walking within the layout. Authorities have started surprise checks and impose spot fines for violations. Please follow this practice with out fail with immediate effect not to escape from the penalties but to save from the Virus.
Over and above wearing of masks
column2: the other key measure is to maintain  safe distance between people irrespective of the age group. When it comes to being on main/cross roads as well as the park
column3: our residents - especially the younger ones and seniors alike are back to how they were during the pre-lockdown period.  The  applicable guideline is seldom followed. Can we all agree to literally enforce this need of the hour in the interest of respective families in particular and our community in general ? We look up to the head of the family in each Villa to take personal responsibility towards this goal. We do not expect security guards to enforce this requirement since they were ridiculed at times when they tried to do so on behalf of the MC.

column1: (3) *Intimation to association regarding anyone in the family having arrived from a travel & needing to undergo quarantine*: We had clearly communicated earlier the need to intimate us about any member/guest into a Villa who has  travelled from designated locations outside of the state. Thanks to those residents who promptly informed via email to association id with details of individuals who come under this category. However
column2: based on intimations from few residents
column3: we are of the opinion that some may have missed. Please make sure the same is meticulously followed and also ensure that the concerned members who are to undergo home quarantine follow strict quarantine guidelines for the prescribed duration.

column2: understanding and  support. *Follow the guidelines & Stay safe*

column1: *Details of Health Officers (HO) of BBMP are given below.*
In cases of emergency you may call them.
The ambulances for shifting Covid+ are with them.
The testing of primary contacts is also assigned to them.
*For asymptomatic primary contacts testing is done ONLY after 12 days.*
*For symptomatic patients it is done immediately at the FOLLOWING fever clinic*.

column2: 12:50 PM - JRPraveenNeighbour: *Guidance: What to do if you are tested Covid Positive?*

column1: 📍📍_Guidance is specific to BBMP Mahadevapura Division
It may not be the news you want
column2: but there is always a chance you get the call confirming that your Covid Test is positive

column1: 1. Call the BBMP Officer as per your BBMP Ward and inform. Share full address and Google location through whatsapp
Nodal officer for Mahadevapura: Dr Surendra 99017 50539
*Escalation*: Joint Commissioner BBMP Mahadevapura Mr. Venkatachalapathy 95133 22144
2. If you are keen to be treated in a private hospital
column2: you can call and confirm availability of beds
column3: treatment cost etc. from one of these 3 hospitals

column1: 3. If you are in a residential complex inform the RWA President or focal point
4. BBMP Health department would need to arrive with an ambulance and make an health assessment. Currently it may take 6-10 hours
5. *Do not self-drive or go with someone to a hospital*

column2: get all the documents ready (Your family cannot come with you)

column1: 7. If you have a medical history file
8. Pack your personal belongings for upto 14 days. Don’t forget your daily medication. Pack dry fruits
9. Don’t forget a thermal flask or an electric kettle to manage your hot water needs
10. Ensure you have packed your mobile charger
column3: power bank. If you feel like taking your laptop
column4: pack the same too. Mobile and laptop will be the only means to stay in touch with your near and dear ones

column1: 11. Ensure you have taken your credit card
column3: Banking details etc. for the payments at the Hospital

column1: 12. If you have decided to avail Government service
column2: then the BBMP Health staff would recommend available Hospital for Symptomatic patients and a Covid Care center for asymptomatic patients. You may not have an option to choose

column1: 13. Start writing down the name and phone number of your primary contacts in the last 7 days. If you had visited any public place like shops
column2: office etc. list it down along with date and time. keep this list ready to hand over to the BBMP Team. Be authentic
cook or driver are a primary contact
column3: ensure your family members have informed them immediately

column2: be ready to leave immediately without making them wait. Once the assessment is done
column3: they would take you to a Private hospital
column4: Government Hospital or Covid Care center 🚑

column2: there are changes in Hospital or CCC after you leave your home
column3: please call and inform your family members

column1: 17. Please be respectful and cooperate with the staff. They are only trying to help amidst this challenging situation
*Steps to take care of your Health*
1. Monitor your body temperature every 1 hour. Call *Apthamitra helpline 14410* and seek guidance incase of fever
2. If you have a Pulse Oximeter
column2: monitor the Oxygen concentration levels every 1 hour. If your Oxygen level is less than 95
column3: alert the Senior Health Inspector immediately. You need emergency attention

column1: 3. Do salt water gargling every 3 hours
4. Eat healthy food and ensure you are well hydrated 🍎🍌🍋🍍
5. Isolate and Stay away from your family members
6. Try and organise a few N95 masks and wear them
7. If you feel like freshening up
8. In case of breathing discomfort or health issues call *Apthamitra helpline 14410*
9. Stay calm and rest till the ambulance arrives
Plz call on my mobile number if you need any help

column1: There have been formal and informal complaints from residents about pet owners not following the stipulated guidelines with in the layout.   We have seen and also received enough complaints from residents about few dogs being taken out with out leash and some times kids taking them for walks and the dog running/charging at someone who is on a walk. There have been instances of dog poop in private lawns
column2: vacant sites and common areas. We have communicated previously too that we are and would like to remain  a  pet friendly layout. However
column3: the same should not be  at a cost of inconvenience to fellow residents.

column2: please ensure your pets are always under leash while stepping out of your Villa and only adults strong enough to handle them should take pets for a walk.  Ensure pets are adequately trained
column3: especially the aggressive breeds irrespective the owner's assessment that they are friendly etc. Pets are animals whose mood swings  cannot be predicted.

column1: Please see below a picture of a child who was badly bitten without provocation in Adarsh Palm. The child survived after being in ICU at Sakra and the dog owner went behind bars.It is not a situation anybody wants to be in
column2: be it the pet Owner or  the Victim.  We expect every pet owner to follow the rules without having to be enforced through Est. Manager or security. Inspite of such reminders
column3: if the owner is found roaming around with the pet with out a leash
column4: leaving pet poop without scooping
column5: the association may be forced to ask the owner to take away  the pet from the society. Please note that we have the third eye recording every movement.

column4: but request everyone to limit their movements and practice social distancing and PROPER use of facemask. Some of the residents have raised concerns about the lack of facemasks or improper use among the residents (both kids and adults) when they are in common areas.

column1: As per request from few residents to reopen the clubhouse and considering the situation of COVID-19
column2: the MC members met last weekend and the conclusion was to open the Clubhouse for Gym
column3: TT and Badminton facilities. The rest of the club house remains closed for any larger gatherings.

column1: Request all the residents to follow these guidelines in the interest of their own health and over all health of the community...
TT and GYM facilities – Maximum of 2 persons at a time (given the size of rooms).
BADMINTON COURT -  Maximum of 4 persons at a time.
SANITIZE your hands before entering the clubhouse facility.
WEAR Masks at all times except while playing.
Please bring your own hand sanitizer and towels.
Ensure cleaning of the equipment before and after use with a wet Tissue (Sanitizer tissues) or a Wet a towel with the sanitizer.
Do not enter the clubhouse if you are having cold
column3: fever or Flu like symptoms.

column1: Educate kids and teenagers in your family not to gather in the clubhouse as it’s an enclosed facility.
Do not entertain visitors to the clubhouse for using these facilities.
Since COVID is still spreading rapidly and Karnataka is among top affected states at the moment
column2: we suggest avoiding doubles for some time keeping in view the proximity of partners and lack of masks. However
column3: we leave it to the discretion and judgement of the players.

column2: 1:42 PM - JR18Jayakumar: Cyclone Nivar is on its way. It will become very severe cyclone by today evening

column1: accornding to IMD prediction if forecasts are going to be correct. Bangalore is going to face it with heavy rain and wind speed of 50-60 km/h.
We have only 1 day(today) for preparation.
1. Ensuring roof is cleaned and RWH pipes are not blocked.
2. Every blocks rain water drains (basement/parking) are not blocked.
3. Road outside at entry gate is higher. Outside water entering MM compound is possible. Ensuring that these water passes through rain water channel.
4. Protect sump - not to allow outside water to enter sumps.
5. Expect power-cut after cyclone is gone. Hence diesel backup may be required.
* Bangalore very rarely comes on the path of a cyclone. Hence
column2: people may not understand the gravity and post-impact of a cyclone.

column1: Rain forecast for Bangalore in next 3 days is ~120mm including 100mm of rain on 25th only.
IMD Updates can be seen here:  https://mausam.imd.gov.in/imd_latest/contents/cyclone.php

column3: OHT etc.*

column1: Keeping in mind the water scarcity and avoiding any water wastage during summer months
column2: the Mgmt Committee has decided that *not to* allow any sump
column3: OHT cleaning as for individual villa between March 1st
column4: 2021 till June 30
column5: 2021 (4 Months).

column1: So residents should plan for sump-OHT cleaning etc. before February 28
It is advisable to do this activity an evening before the scheduled weekly water release day.
*Best case*  - Plan this cleaning on Tuesday evening.
Step 1 - Get the OHT filled up in the morning on Tuesday.
Step 2 - Now power off the sump motor.  The water pumped in the OHT will be consumed during the day.
Step 3 - Clean the OHT first in the evening.
Step 4 - Now pump the water up into the OHT.
Wednesday morning is one of the weekly water release day. so you will get sump filled up the on Wednesday morning.
Avoid sump/OHT cleaning on any other days as it is not possible to release water on individual requests arbitrarily.
Treat this as a sincere request to act in time.

column2: 6:57 AM - +91 74063 33000: That's great guidance !! We did sump cleaning couple of weeks back. We closed the sump water knob and waited for water to get consumed. Believe or not sump water lasted 7 days for us. May be our consumption is less but this shows how much water gets wasted during cleaning.

column3: which woke up people who were in sound sleep around. The source of the disturbance was from 5th cross Wipro side witnessed by even association member. Inspite of being warned by Security nd Police personnel   the loud noises continued for few more hours.

column1: In spite of many personnel requests & warnings from association/neighborhood
column2: these parties/loud noises in the night are repeating by people who show no remorse to their behavior. There are specific places for these kind of celebrations/shouting/screaming/loud music but not residential premises. Most of us just curse them for disturbing us and go back to sleep or sleepless over the night or call the security which will not have any effect on them. We can also see the futile attempt by association towards this issue. We can't continue to live like this anymore.

column1: Loud noise after 10:00 P.M is against law
column2: some of our own educated residents who are responsible citizen/parents/neighbors are breaking the rules repeatedly. Its no joke. We have to think about what we are passing to the next generation as responsible parents.

column1: Events like new year or community celebrations are exceptions which happens once a year but they do have minimal disturbance to the community after 10:00 PM when rest of the nature is sound. But partying every week is really not tolerable. Every day every family has some or the other reasons to celebrate and possible to bring  friends and party the whole night/burst crackers/balloons/bang doors/scream/laugh/honk/break glasses etc etc  waking up the whole community nd other neighboring communities too. Do you expect this reaction as a solution? or can we stop these kind of thoughtless
column2: senseless and  mindless  behaviors and maintain  peace / harmony in the community.

column2: we're sure you all are following the daily increase in COVID cases and it clearly appears that we are marching towards another crest. Bangalore is seeing a daily uptick and we have learned about few positive cases reported in Kodathi gate. As a result
column3: MC members reviewed and felt the need to reiterate the following:

column1: *1.	Wearing of masks while stepping out of your villa*: Keeping exceptions (like running
column3: we would like to make this a mandatory requirement. Kids should wear masks in the park area too.

column1: *2.	Inform association if you/family/friend is/are arriving from a travel and need(s) to undergo quarantine*: Please note that it is mandatory to inform association at jrgassociation@gmail.com
3. We've learned that panchayat office reported an infected staff and hence suggest avoiding visiting their office for sometime.

4. Last and probably the most important thing – *please do not organize group celebration/procession this Holi*. Our vibrant community has seen amazing Holi celebration in the past and we’re sure we will get many more occasions to repeat the same
We wish you all a safe and happy Holi. Should you’ve any questions
column2: please drop an email to association email address.

column1: Value of homemaker’s work same as hubby’s at office: SC.
She was a "housewife". When she died in a scooter accident along with her husband
column2: the insurance company calculated compensation only based on the husband's income. But the court would not accept it.
the court stated that a homemaker's work contributes
column3: "In a very real way to the economic condition of the family
column4: and the economy of the nation
column5: regardless of the fact that it may have been traditionally excluded from economic analyses. It is a reflection of changing attitudes and mindsets and of our international law obligations. Most importantly
column6: it is a step towards the constitutional vision of social equality and ensuring dignity of life to all individuals.”

column1: Bench of Justices N V Ramana and Surya Kant
column2: thank you. I hope this marks a major new change.

column1: The COVID numbers inside JRG are growing. It's time to enforce some strict and straight discipline.
1. Close any and all possible places where people gather. This includes parks
column3: basketball and tennis court. This anyway is suggested by Govt. too. That's a small sacrifice we all can make instead of a collective misery.

column1: 2. Tell people to postpone all possible ventures outside of JRG. Self discipline has to be enforced. JRG MC can not make house arrests but it's the people to question themselves.
3. Should not stop maids and home deliveries
column2: but advise all residents to ask maids to wear masks at all times. Use sanitizers liberally.

column1: 4. Masks should be worn at all times when stepping outside. This is MANDATORY
column2: and is strictly to be forces by the security. ALL have to follow
column3: and that includes all age groups. Security will be asked to clearly enforce this and report the deviations to MC. Encourage the grown up kids to respect others and wear the masks - always and correctly.

column1: 5. Any travellers into JRG (friends and relatives) should be seen with utmost caution. MC should be notified via email
column2: and proper entry and exit at security gate is expected. This helps in contact tracing.

column1: 6. No construction activity will be allowed over the weekend
column2: as per govt. guidelines on weekend curfew. Labor and workers should be advised accordingly. Any request for deviation will be denied prima facie.

column1: All these guidelines are for the collective safety and with immediate effect.

column1: Hope everyone is doing well and staying healthy.
In light of the continued cases of delayed maintenance payments from many of the owners and residents
column2: the MC has decided that the following steps will be taken moving forward.

column1: 1.	2 weeks duration will be given for all demand notes
2.	5 days before the due date a reminder will be sent by the Estate manager

column2: the villas numbers that are still pending will be put in the clubhouse notice board.  This list will be updated on a daily basis to reflect the payments being made.
all outstanding maintenance will attract a penalty of 1.5% per month computed from due date of payment.

column1: 5.	Club house and common amenities access would be restricted 1 month after the payment due date. Housekeeping activities would also stop for the defaulting villas. We will obviously take into account non payment of maintenance for NOCs
column3: move-out and rentals

column1: The above steps will be put in place starting from the next demand note that is expected in mid July 2022. As communicated earlier
column2: the demand notes would be shared around 15th of the first month every quarter

column1: It gives an Immense Pleasure to make all of your Acquittance for Voter’s ID Enrolment on _*10th June 2022 at 1.00 PM  -6  PM*_.
Please find the documents required on the Voter’s ID camp which are enlisted below.
BANK PASSBOOK WITH PHOTO & BANK SEAL
BESCOM BILL WITH CLEAR NAME & ADDRESS IN RESIDENTS NAME
REGISTERED COMPANY LETTER HEAD WITH PHOTO AND SEAL.
RESIDENTS CAN WALK IN TO OUR DESK WITH POI

column2: Contact No and Agency will Upload your Hard Copy Documents(After Originals being Verified) online immediately and provide you with the Acknowledgement Instantly.

Enrollee will receive a message on status of Voter’S ID Number within Couple of Weeks on Registered Mobile No and once the Voter’s ID Number is Created Resident can collect the card from nearest BBMP Office by carrying their Original Govt ID Proof along with the Voter’s ID No or the Residents can Track  & Download the Voter’s ID from National Voter’s Service Portal on https://www.nvsp.in/Forms/trackstatus.

column1: Important Note :  IDFC First Bank is only Facilitating the drive .
Voter’s ID Agency will only be uploading the documents and not be responsible to generate the Voter’s ID Cards.
Voter’s ID Agency would need one  tables and few chairs and a power socket in the same area.
IDFC First Bank will park marketing collaterals at Venue and be present with Bank Managers for the promotion and lead generation of Banking products(1PM-6PM).
Kindly feel free to get back for any assistance or further clarifications on the same.
Assuring you the Best of Services.

column1: One of the issues we are facing when it rains at JRG
column2: is the rainwater from the terrace of many villas is getting into the Sewage system.  This is putting a lot of stress on the STP infrastructure both power and the material that is being consumed for the treatment process.

column1: We have instructed Avijit to go to each villa to investigate if the terrace water from the villa is going into the sewage system.  He will be doing that by each cross starting with the 1st cross and working his way down.

We request all residents to cooperate with Avijit on this activity including giving him a few (2-3 buckets of water per villa) to perform this investigation.  If you are not available on the specific dates
column2: please reach out to Jayaram or Avijit to coordinate as needed.

column1: Meanwhile we would request all residents to remain vigilant and stay safe.

column1: This year the auspicious Ganesh Chaturthi is on 31 August.

JRG has always come together with full enthusiasm and devotion to celebrate this festival. This year too we intend to celebrate  for 3 days with many activities involving everyone and make it successful.
Your contribution will help us make this event successful. We request all devotees in JRG to come forward and contribute  for this festival.
* Your monetary contribution is completely voluntary. You can participate in the festival even without paying anything. Your payment only helps in organizing the resources for the festival.
* There's no minimum or maximum amount.

4. Crawling traffic at ORR Bellandur near Ecospace
5. Crawling traffic at Sarjapur Road near Rainbow Drive
6. Standstill traffic at Yemalur Main Road due to flooding near Shobha Palladium Apartments
1. Avoid venturing out and Work from Home except for emergency
30+ Apartment Complexes are still inundated with water and the basements have 1 feet or more water
- Spice Garden in Old Airport Rd
- Borewell Road DNA Apartments and Surrounding areas
- Forum Value mall and surrounding areas
- Balagere Main Road and surrounding areas
Request all residents to exercise utmost caution and avoid venturing out
Emergency response teams and more support is being mobilised to support all the impacted residents

10:14 AM - +91 90080 60684: *Post from my friend of Tata Motors
column3: worth reading*

column1: I am working in Tata Motors for last 16 years handling Vehicle Crash Safety and now handling Airbags
column2: Seat belts and Steering wheel.  I have witnessed many crash tests
column3: designed and evaluated structures whether it meets the safety requirements
column4: currently designing Airbags
column5: Seat  belts and steering wheel to make occupants safer.

column1: There is a need to know some fundamentals for wearing seatbelt and related to our sitting position in the car ..
I request all of you to read
column2: understand and implement / follow for your safety ...share as much as you can.

column1: 1. Seatbelt is the primary protection and airbag is the secondary protection .
2. This means that Airbag alone will not protect WITHOUT wearing seatbelt
column2: in fact it may hurt or kill or hurt badly..
*body ( trunk) shall be minimum 300 mm away from steering wheel*.

column1: Closer than this distance even if seatbelt is used and airbag operates
column2: driver will not be protected .. so stay away from steering minimum 300 mm..( VERY IMPORTANT).

column1: 4. Sit comfortably and ensure the buttock is not tilted towards the steering it will make drivers slide in case of accident . Original seats are provided to prevent the slide..
5. Never-Never fix crash bars or the side bars in your cars on your own...These may protect the vehicle but will kill the passengers inside due to improper impact load transfer
column2: and also altering the crumbling zone
column3: based on which the Airbags are designed to respond in 35 Milli seconds ..
steering wheel
column4: Airbag ECU
column5: wiring harness must be replaced once it gets used. This must be done at the authorised dealer end only..

column1: 7. Headrest for driver and the co-passenger is very very crucial. With safety belt and airbags in  functioning condition without having headrest in the right place ( see vehicle manual for correct position) will break the neck after the impact ..I saw the video and clearly seen how important it is to have headrest in position ..
I am not sure how many of us are aware that headrests are detachable and they carry sharp wedges at the end
column2: which can be used for breaking the window if one is stuck inside the car
column3: post accident.

column1: 8. Irrespective of distance to travel wear seatbelt
column2: it is not for long drives only
column3: it is the impact that matters not the distance ...

column1: 9. All passengers ( front and rear)  to wear seatbelt ...kids need to be protected well too with safety cradles...
10. Be careful in keeping loose items in the car .. as they could turn into missiles on high velocity impact ...put them in the boot..
The amazing engineering that had gone into these delvelopments
column3: incorporated by carmakers have to be used for protecting us and our near and dear ones.
thanks for sharing!

12:41 PM - JRVenu: Dear Residents and MC members

column1: I understand that the last few days have been trying days for the community.  I have tried to be a calming force and have been asking the MC team to be a calming force.  But unfortunately
column2: I am not being successful in this. We have been having meeting with the parties and trying to do the needful
column3: but that requires trust in the parties and the willingness to want to get to a solution.

column2: but I am sad to see that the community is going through a mob mindset with all the messages
column3: and comments (from MC and from community) have been very negative and insinuating.  We are moving very very far from “Harmonious community” and becoming a highly polarized community. The adrenaline is pumping hard and calmness is not coming back.  I cannot with an honest conscious preside over a MC that is not calm and just keep promoting calmness
column4: nor be part of a MC that is not a calming force to the community.

column1: My request all the senior citizens to help play a part in calming the community and promote discussion.  Everyone of us will benefit from you experience and guidance.

column3: *I am resigning from my post as President of JRGSHOA and also the MC*.  I would like to request the MC team to elect and interim President to take things forward.

column1: @Ananth… as the Secretary I guess you need to send me the acceptance of the resignation so that it is documented
@Nidhi you have done an amazing job as a Treasurer and hope to see you continue the good work. Please request the banks to deactivate my access so that it can be transferred to the next President.
Thank you all for the opportunity to serve you
column2: and hope I was able to deliver some value to the MC and the community.

column1: This is to inform you that one our residents is hosting a private party at the Club House lawn this evening.

column2: they have sought the required permissions from the civic authorities to play music on a loud-speaker between 7-10PM.

column1: They have taken all precautions to ensure no one is inconvenienced due the same.

column2: in case any of you have concerns
column3: please reach out to the said family and/or anyone in the MC
column4: such that the same can be communicated and taken care of.

column1: Let us all play our part as good citizens and wish the family on the joyous occasion.
This has reference to the recent incident in our JR Greenwich community that led to levels of misunderstandings and escalations that are rare in a society like ours.
Few of us had an opportunity to dig deep into what went wrong. The discussions helped identify the  mis-conceived expectations and notions within our community members.
Instead of listing them as pin pointers
column2: we are making an attempt to provide notes of clarification in 3 broad categories as below :

column1: *1)Nature of our community - the constituents and their surroundings within the layout*:

JR Greenwich is a BDA approved layout consisting of independent plots and Villas registered to the concerned buyers. The common areas like roads and parks are registered to BDA. Club house is built on JR Housing plots

column2: it’s like a micro-community that is there in BDA layouts of Indiranagar or Koramangala
column3: except that we enjoy a project boundary wall to provide additional security to its residents and dedicated amenities as mentioned above.

column1: *2) Specific roles and responsibilities of RW Association and the MCs*:

We would like to reiterate that Association’s primary role is to maintain the common areas of the community by collecting proportionate maintenance charges from the residents/plot owners. Needless to say supply of water to homes
column3: water
column4: lighting in common areas
column5: repairs and fixes to common layout infrastructure
column8: deciding norms for ongoing constructions etc are some of  the major deliverables for the association.

column2: our Association is also expected to coordinate with local government bodies and private agencies  for utilities/ services  beneficial to the community eg. broadband
column3: water supply
column4: gas pipeline

column1: Association is *not* responsible to handle litigations or court cases on independent plots or members thereof. It has to be handled by the respective impacted parties only.

column2: handle / settle any legal disputes between the members
column3: that have arisen due to an act of one or more of such members in their individual capacity.  However
column4: if requested and the MC finding such requests relevant
column5: the association may choose to facilitate for a peaceful dialogue between the parties in the larger interest of the community.

column1: *3) Roles and responsibilities of individual members/residents*:
Role of individual member/ resident is the same as the role of any Citizen of our country.
Residents do not have any higher privileges being a resident at JR Greenwich apart from amenities being made accessible at one place and becoming part of a vibrant gated community.
If an individual has any concern with a neighbor
column2: the aggrieved member has every right to be heard in accordance with the applicable law as provided.

column1: It is our responsibility to understand the provisions of all applicable laws keeping in mind the judicial saying "ignorance of law is no excuse".

column2: we humbly urge residents not to take law into their hands and resort to any acts of violence disturbing the very nature of our peaceful community.

column1: On behalf of all the parties that are responsible to build this layout to the level that it is today
column2: I urge all the members to take note of the above points and help grow this community to a vibrant one and making it harmonious & peaceful in its true sense.

column1: We very much appreciate your support in this regard. 🙏🏼

column1: Also curious to understand why there are 2 demand notes here?

We have been getting quite a few queries on demand note that was sent to help build the CapEx funds for JRGSHOA.  This is the fund that should have been technically in excess of 50L (50K x 100 villas). But we currently have only 33L in this account.
The deficit in the corpus is primarily due to a number of capital expenses that we have invested in the last 4+ years.  As you can understand
column2: we need to build this fund back as we are getting to the point where there will be many infrastructure related upgrades and investments that we need to do.  We understand that we cannot get to the 50L level in one step
column3: and hence have asked for a 1st level of replenishment by asking for 10K from each of the villa.

column1: The infrastructure investments that we are doing will benefit all the current villas
column3: the upgrades and cleaning of drains
column4: the compliance and upgrade of STP
column5: and the addition of street light poles and replace them.  These items will be done for all plots occupied or otherwise.

column1: We have discussed this in the MC meetings
column2: and later even discussed this in the open house that was conducted a few months back.  In addition to the meetings
column3: we have also mentioned the need for this additional demand notes in our past communications.

column1: I hope this message will address most (if not all) of the queries
column2: and we hope to have your support in building back the corpus fund.

column1: PS: The regular maintenance demand note will be coming out next week.  That has nothing to do with demand note we sent out earlier for 10K.

column1: Would also appreciate if MC lets us know regarding a rational time that we should expect an answer

One of the messages in the group was asking what is the parameters when WhatApp group get locked.  I was drafting a set of parameters… but realized that the messages have evolved from whatsapp to voice calls. So realized that there is no point in sharing any guidelines.

During the last few days lot of hate filled and negative calls questioning the competency of the MC have been coming to some of the MC members.  The calls not got to a point that they started impacting personal and family lives of MC members. If the intension is to insult and harass the few volunteers that were willing to help run the association… CONRATULATIONS… you have just succeeded.  *MC members are already starting to regret their decision to volunteer and are thinking of resigning. *
If MC members start resigning… we will have to dissolve the MC.  I guess we can have our own version of the wild-west.

Despite what each of you think… there is lot of work happening in the background on the heated pool and many of the points that were raised in the AGM.  All of these items need lot of time and effort from many folks as we need to find solutions that is acceptable by all parties.

The strange thing is that none of the individuals who are making all these allegations are either willing to contribute the time or help run this community operations.  These folks are just calling and messaging to spread negativity.

NONE of the MC needs the extra stress.  We keep spending many hours every week and all the MC members are getting is calls and messages from the community questioning their intentions and competency.  Hence the reluctance to be part of the MC… because
column2: being a MC members does not looks like helping build and manage a vibrant community
column3: it looks like an excellent recipe to convert friends/neighbour to enemies.

column1: *Please do let us know if you do not want a Management Committee*… and you will find a way to magically run the community.  I am sure the MC will be happy to step down and let each of you run your own show.
