Let us address the ongoing concerns about the heated pool. There is a lot of background work being done on this. However
column3: we haven't shared it with all so far because we wanted to come up with recommendations (with supporting data) before bringing it out to avoid any further confusion.

column1: *Actions so far by Heated Pool Subcommittee*
• Team collected & documented all the relevant data
column2: such as actions taken by the previous MC
column3: Heated pool Vs. The solar decision
column4: voting results
column5: previous year's heat pump energy consumption/pattern
column7: Avg monthly consumption in a year

column1: • We also discussed the various viewpoints that residents had
column3: emails
column4: etc.
column5: and realized that any decision must be in alignment with the community as a whole

column1: • We extended the subcommittee to 7 Members(3MC + 4 Non-MC) at *Jan end*
column2: We have a balanced representation of varying opinions we received
column3: The objective of this extended sub-committee was to find a collective
column4: logical
column5: and a long-term solution

column1: • Existing data was presented to all the Sub-committee members to brainstorm over the next few *weekly* meetings; once the team was on the same page with and agreed in principle that Solar is not an alternative to heat our indoor pool
column2: we decided to move forward with what best we can do with the heated pump.

column1: • It was noticed that though we had sufficient data from our own pool
column2: we did not have any testimonials to learn from
column3: issues like

column1: • Do we need AMC? If yes
column2: how much is the cost? Any other hidden cost in the long run?

column1: • What is the ideal heat pool temperature?
• any other society using this for more than five years?

column2: Team decided to survey 6-7 other societies that are using heated pumps
column3: possibly in similar climatic conditions
column4: and have been using them for more than two years

column2: we divided ourselves and interviewed the heated pool in charge of more than five such societies
column3: collected the data
column4: and debriefed the rest of the team

column3: and Timelines*

column1: 1.	Once we complete the debrief on the remaining interviews will prepare the recommendations; this should be done hopefully by *this weekend*
column2: again depending on the availability of the team members.
we intend to call for a resident meeting((in person/online) to brief the findings and the next action. The meeting date shall be communicated as we progress on the first part.
we agree that communication with the residents was delayed. However
column3: we assure you that the team has been working hard on this since its inception
column4: and you will be satisfied with the research done to make the *right decision*.

9:26 AM - +91 97405 83964: *Do you Know? - Being a REGISTERED Voter has a direct bearing on FUNDS and RESOURCES allocated to our neighbourhood*

column1: If you are not a *REGISTERED VOTER IN MAHADEVAPURA* plz read further
Bengaluru has 27 Assembly constituencies and Mahadevapura constituency is a YOUNG constituency carved out in 2008
Mahadevapura Constituency area is 115.18 sq.kms while Chamarajpet Constituency is 4.31 sq.kms. Sample of other small area constituencies are also attached for reference
*Our MLA Shri Aravind Limbavali has to administer 27 times larger area and 3 times more registered voter population*
We all know there is still a large number of residents who have not bothered to REGISTER as Voters or TRANSFER their Votes from other parts of Bengaluru
Many Civic groups and citizen volunteers have been trying hard to enrol more voters in the last few years and have seen good success
Assembly Constituencies are carved out once in 25 years based on Number of Registered Voters and Census data
1. The Government of Karnataka Grants have a bearing on the Constituency and funds get allocated per Constituency
2. BBMP Wards was carved out recently based on the Voter count
3. BBMP Funding and Staff allocation is dependent on Ward Count
4. Administration is spread thin if the area of the ward/constituency is larger
5. Government Services are also suboptimal if the area of administration increases
1. If you are NOT A REGISTERED VOTER in Mahadevapura
column2: plz use online Voter Helpline website or app and REGISTER TODAY. Takes less than 12 minutes to complete

column1: 2. Encourage your friends and relatives to REGISTER as Voters
3. Encourage youngsters in the age group of 18-25 to APPLY and REGISTER as Voters

column2: 8:15 AM - JrPrashanth47: *MUST READ - Important Traffic Advisory 2 : ORR Doddanekundi Flyover*

column1: 🚩 _Plz circulate this message within your residential complex whatsapp groups & office groups_
*Context: Metro Works Gantry crane moving into critical position at Doddanekundi flyover*
Considering the benefit of a midweek holiday & lower traffic this week
column2: the Metro work in the critical position is planned starting from the morning of *Tuesday 27th June 2023*

column1: Based on a joint coordination meeting following are the plans for the works &  managing traffic below Doddanekundi flyover
1. DBM Layer asphalting of the middle lane upto the Junction will be done on Monday 26th June night
2. ORR Service road from Vishnu Palace till Ferns City Road will be blocked for Traffic movement from morning of Tuesday 27th June

column2: the Traffic towards Marathahalli will be diverted to the middle lane on Tuesday 27th June

column1: 4. Bagmane to ensure the Main Gate of Bagmane Constellation IT Park is closed and both IN/OUT Traffic is diverted through Goshala Road
5. On Thursday night 29th June the Gantry will move forward and be positioned infront of IDBI
6. On Thursday night after 10:00 PM and Friday Morning Ferns City Road residents would have to access ORR through the “Bus Stand plot” and reach Bhagini Hotel and return the same way
7. On Friday night 30th June the first set of U Girders will be installed in front of IDBI
8. On Saturday night 1st July the Second set of U Girders will be installed in front of Vishnu Grand
9. Further movement of Gantry & Traffic Management will be brainstormed
10. The Installation of the COMPOSITE GIRDER at the Goshala Road Junction is planned around 15th July
*What does it mean for Commuters in Four Wheelers  & Two Wheelers?*
1. All commuters IN & OUT of Bagmane Constellation
column3: GoldStone & Capital to compulsorily use the Flyover to reach or exit your campus. Do not come below the Doddanekundi Flyover

column1: 2. Residents of Durga Petals & Commuters going towards  Alpine Eco Road to compulsorily use the flyover. Do not come below the Doddanekundi Flyover
3. Residents in Doddanekundi village to use alternative route instead of using the Service Road
4. We anticipate FREQUENT TRAFFIC GRIDLOCKS below the Doddanekundi Flyover. So plz plan your trips accordingly
5. Hectic work would be happening in the night between 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM. Plz avoid using both sides Service road if possible. Anticipate frequent & long traffic stoppages below the flyover
The *NEXT 6 days* are very critical in terms of Traffic Management. Request your cooperation with the Traffic Police & the Traffic Marshals who will be there to manage the Traffic Congestion

column1: One of the areas that we are always trying to keep a close eye on is the safety and security of our community.  As part of this process
column2: we are pleased to inform you that we have a new security vendor that will be taking charge from 27th July 2023.

column1: This update will give us a fresh team with new outlook and ideas on how to keep our community safer. It will hopefully also address some of the  security issues that few of the residents faced in the last few months.
A few things that we wanted to share about the transition:
1. All the team members have been interviewed individually and screened for their roles.
2. Both the supervisors have been interviewed and selected by the estate-manager and a couple of MC members.
3. The new team has been trained on the MyGate system.
4. The new team has been trained on the SOP (standard operating procedure) that we have put in place for their daily duties.
The new team will try to ramp-up as quickly as possible
column2: but it would be greatly appreciated if all of you can lend your support to them and the estate manager during this transition phase.

column1: We will ask the supervisors to spend some time to familiarize themselves to each of you when they come across you.  So
column2: please do spend a few seconds to introduce yourself to the team.

column1: Please keep an eye out for changes/new security measures that we would be taking as part of this process.
Thank you all and have a great day.

column1: Good evening ! Hope this message finds you in good spirits.

Today I’m saddened to put my plots at Phase-1 up for sale with a heavy heart. Unfortunately the main culprit being the 8 storied  illegal and unauthorised structures that have come up on the eastern boundary of Phase-1 taking away much of the privacy and adoration with which this community was built.
I sincerely and humbly request the residents of JR Greenwich to not support such reckless developments by investing in such blatant PG schemes
column2: during and post development of which will take away much of the peace and serenity of its surroundings.

column1: ·         Ensure you sleep for at least 6 hours
·         Have a proper healthy breakfast/lunch in the 4 hours prior to donation
·         The gap between food and blood donation should not exceed 4 hours
·         Do not smoke in the 2 hours prior to donation
·         Do not consume alcohol 24 hours prior to donation
·         If you are on medication please inform the doctor
·         If you had undergone any surgery
column3: ear or body piercing
column4: tattooing you are not eligible to donate blood for one year

column1: ·         People who are on medication for hypertension or blood sugar are eligible to donate if their levels are under control
·         Take at least 300 ml (500 ml for first time donors) water before donating blood
·         Weight above 45 kg for both males and females
·         Hemoglobin levels above 12.5 g/dl for both males and females
·         Donor should be in good general health
·         BP should be under control prior to donation
1. People with diabetes can donate if their sugar levels are controlled and they are not on insulin.

column3: chickenpox
column4: etc defer you for 6 months

column1: 3. For infections like typhoid 1 year waiting period.
4. For rabies or hepatitis vaccination it's 1 year.
For Tetanus vaccine it's 30 days. For COVID vaccination 14 days
5. Other medical conditions have different deferral criteria. Please let the doctor (s) on-spot know the exact details.

column2: 6:09 PM - +91 98801 52162: Very simple solution to RO refuse water reuse is to lead the refuse pipe to a bucket and use that water for mopping
column3: washing vessels
column4: car. Also dont keep the RO filter ON always.. switch on only when both filtered water tank and refuse water bucket are empty to take more water. This way you can ensure there is no waste water run off.

column1: We have been doing this for 15 years now
column2: haven't observed any degradation in shine of flooring or vessels.

9. Dry Holi celebration is suggested to residents.

The caller said that his SIM and Adhar have been used to procure arms and narcotics in Lucknow and he is being prosecuted by police. The caller then transferred the call claiming the person at the other end as the police officer. The other person turned on his video for a few seconds to be seen in his police uniform and a board behind him displaying UP Police.... He goes off video and says it is a serious case and an arrest warrant is out but he could help if some money is transferred. My relative told him to come to Bangalore and disconnected the call.... Sending this just to sensitize how much preparation these scamsters do to look authentic to a gullible person at the other end !!!!! column2: 10:12 AM - +91 97405 83964: ** Regarding Green waste disposal from Garden(s) and streets****

column1: We pay considerable sum of money (in the figures of 40-50k per year) to transport and dispose the green waste. Objective is to reduce this cost and also reuse this waste to generate more manure. We are soliciting suggestions from all of you for this objective
column2: below are the issues which we are currently facing:
we collect this in phase-2 last empty plots which has a danger of catching fire during summer months (a recent incident has happened).

column1: 2. Our vendor is increasing the dump cost and transportation cost year by year.

column2: our vendor is reluctant to take more waste and demanding much more money as they are running out of dumping locations.

column1: 1. Earlier we had installed few green color cages (count is approx 8-10) to collect this waste and convert it to manure. Present number is not enough and we need at least 30 more such cages.
2. There was an idea of digging pits for collecting this waste

column1: In light of the recent water shortage in Bangalore
column2: the management committee has taken an initiative which aims to encourage kids during their holidays to utilize their time wisely while educating them about the current water shortage crisis in Bangalore. The main topic for this competition centres around *"Save Water"* .

column1: *1.Group/Solo poster making* - Children/adults can either work alone or in groups to create posters to raise awareness on the shortage of water.
*2. Creative expression* - Children/adults can showcase  their unique skills in writing
column3: dance
column4: singing
column5: skits or any other form to throw light on the current water shortage and the importance to save water.

column1: Please register yourself by *April 11th* and submit your posters or artwork to the clubhouse by *18th April*. Any other form of expression must be sent in *video format* to the following number xyz by *18th April.* please ensure all the submitted work is original.
Register yourself using the below link.
🏆 🎁 🥇 Stand a chance to win exciting prizes  🎁 🏆🥇

We are uncomfortable to walk around the society sometimes because of dogs being unleashed. I understand that they are pets and good to you and your family. In the past I have been attacked by a dog and it's scary. Think about elderly person and their heart conditions.
Please understand that their behaviour is not entirely in our control.
I kindly request not to unleash then while walking in the road and park.

column2: 11:41 PM - +91 78292 22422: There is a bit of difference between a trained dog and an untrained dog. Possibilities of a Trained dogs going out of order are relatively less.  These dogs can be good on rescue or guide when opportunity arises if given a chance. But with leash the chances of them getting geared for situation is less since we restrict their movement. They sniff threat before we can see them. However all of these instincts gets tamed down when you leash. My dog is trained to no/ Stay/ Stop commands. I personally believe other species also have equal rights to the planet. However since a concern has been raised I will leash Argo till the gate.

We are happy to announce the commencement of additional 15 Rain Water Harvest cum Recharge pits in select locations along the main road and the cross roads.🌧💧Additionally
column2: a thorough cleanup of our existing 6 pits will be done to ensure they are in optimal condition for the purpose meant for. This project is handled by the same vendor (Munikrishna) who successfully completed our previous project in 2019.

column1: 1. Our previous pits were mainly focused on rejuvenating the existing borewells
column2: which yielded the desired results and continue to support in spite of increased pressure from the multiple borewells drilled in the neighbouring land.

column1: 2. Due to the changed scenario and the dynamics around
column2: the advice from the experts was to focus on digging recharge pits in strategic locations away from the neighbouring land. The points chosen this time are in line with that advice. Apart from strengthening the ground water by way of continuous recharge during the rainy season
column3: our objective is to look for drawing water from a shallow well (borewell that is of a depth up to 200 feet) in the near future.

column1: This project marks a significant step towards sustainable water management within our community. By harnessing the power of rainwater and maintaining our current infrastructure
column2: we aim to reduce our dependency on external water sources.

column1: We intend to complete this activity before the end of this month and try to minimise inconvenience to the residents as much as possible.  Your support and cooperation is vital in making this activity a success. For any queries you may have
column3: do speak to Jayaram or drop a note to jrgassociation@gmail.com. Thanks

column2: who's own pit cant help much) can contribute financially to help dig more  and more pits. I feel the main problem is next year when all these PGs will be operational.

Once again thank you to all who are involved in this 🙏🙏🙏

column1: Our phase 1 borewell is experiencing a significant strain due to a combination of factors
column2: including prolonged heat wave conditions and unscientific drilling of borewells along our eastern compound wall. Water output is fast depleting and our primary source of water is about to go "totally dry" in the next couple of days.

column1: With immediate effect and until further notice
column2: please note we are taking the following actions to address the situation:

column1: 1. *Activate the back up plan* - increase the daily tankers from the current vendor to such numbers as needed  to address the shortfall. Please note
column2: this uptake will have an impact on the maintenance charges from now on.

column1: 2. *Insist on judicious  usage*: We kindly ask all residents to use water wisely and conserve it during this challenging period. It's important to note that we've already taken two proactive measures viz.
column2: checking and fixing any leaks and providing aerators to help save water. Here are some steps you can take to help conserve water:
such as watering lawns and washing cars.

column1: b. Fix any leaks in faucets
c. Take shorter showers and turn off the tap while brushing teeth
d. Use water-efficient appliances and fixtures.
e. Educate your family members and house helps about the importance of water conservation.
3. *Implementation of Water Slabs*: In light of the seriousness of the situation
column2: a system of water slabs will be implemented to effectively manage water usage. Note: The Water Management Sub-committee is currently working on defining these slabs and associated charges.

column1: Note: MC *may decide* to reduce the frequency of water release from 3 to 2 times a week if the situation warrants

We urge everyone to be mindful of their water usage and to implement water-saving measures.  Your cooperation is of utmost importance to navigate through this challenging period with minimal disruption.
Further updates will follow as the situation progresses or an emerging situation warrants. Thanks
